Reviews.Title: “Great value and location near Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Rusty321
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with San Lio Tourist House last minute for a great price during Carnivale (which was terrific by the way, as Venice is at any time of year). We were very thankful that we were upgraded from the economy room as we had our baby with us. The upgraded room had a larger bed than the economy room. It appeared to have been recently renovated, the bedding was new and comfortable. I definitely recommend the San Lio Tourist House, it's easy to get to from Rialto Bridge (they have a video on their website that walks you through the street, so it's really quite easy to get to). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dandi_London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Lio guest house for one night in early March. The check-in was slightly strange in that the main reception and check-in was in a different hotel so we went into San Lio and then spoke to the owner via a TV screen who told us to come to the other guest house to pick up our keys (it was a 2 minute walk). We were able to leave our luggage at San Lio while we did this. The process was simple and problem-free, just a bit strange, although we had been told about it in advance by email. We had booked an economy room but the man at check-in said that he had upgraded us to a standard room which had been renovated 2 weeks ago. We didnâ€™t see any other rooms so were unable to compare. The room was basic but sufficient. We had clean towels, shower gel sachets and soap, and there was a flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom looked like it had been renovated â€“ it was modern with an excellent power shower. The location of the hotel was central and ideal for sight-seeing â€“ near to lots of restaurants and shops, between the Rialto Bridge and St Markâ€™s Square. Both were about a 5 minute walk away. It wasnâ€™t overlooking a canal but I think you pay more for that kind of view. Our room overlooked a square which it was noisy (the windows were single glazed) and the curtains were thin, so our nightâ€™s sleep was quite interrupted. I imagine it would have been worse if we were visiting during the busy summer season. The other rooms may have been quieter if they were further from the square. We didnâ€™t take the breakfast option at the hotel which was an extra 12 euros. Overall, this hotel was comfortable and excellently located for the main sights of Venice. Given the location, we expected a bit of noise but I wouldnâ€™t recommend if you want peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in Venice...Good Price”
Reviews.Author: MeliQ
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at how nice this place was. The place is not particularly hard to find, but we did struggle just considering that everything is a maze in Venice! When you take the 6.50euro waterbus from the train station to the hostel...get off at Rialto, not Rialto Mercato (which is the stop before). It is very easy from Rialto and they email you a map before your arrival. We just got off at the wrong Rialto stop :) You do check in at another location, but it was very nearby (1 minute walk). Our room was small, but very clean and nice. They even hung our towels over a towel warmer, which made bath time more enjoyable. It was very small, but shower water pressure was good. The location was excellent, near lots of great restaurants and very near the Rialto bridge. We had a great stay, even though we had to walk to a sister hotel to check in.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: DessertIsland
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and that isn't necessarily a bad thing. The location of this hotel is an absolute dream for everyone travelling to Venice, especially those of us on a tight budget. Be warned, you have to check in at a sister hotel which is a couple of corners away. It can be a little difficult to find on your own, so make sure that you're equipped with a map or some way of contacting the front desk. Other than that, this hotel is very satisfactory for the budget traveller. The rooms were quite small indeed, but they were very clean and well-kept. The staff were all very friendly and the gentleman at the check-in desk (at the hotel round the corner) spoke excellent English. There is no breakfast or meal service, but with prices so low, it's to be expected. There are several cafes and restaurants close by, though, and even a few mini-markets, so we never found that that was a problem. The pub across the square from the hotel can get a little loud around the weekend, so this may be a problem for light sleepers. Staying at this hotel will also cut your transport expenses in half as it is possible to walk to many of the most interesting destinations in Venice in only a few minutes. Just make sure you have a map with you!

Reviews.Title: “Pay your money, take your choice!”
Reviews.Author: mrtall1975
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is nothing short of fantastic.You could not be more central. A few minutes walk from St Marks one way and the Realto bridge the other. Also easy to find your way back to after being lost for hours!! If you watch the online video on you tube a few times you will feel you have been there already ...spooky!! Cheap for venice and yes a bit damp with the smallest shower cubical you have ever seen! Venice is a bit damp generally..... maybe because it is 'floating' in the water? The only reason I can't offer a 4/5 rating is the air con died on us on the last (very hot) night. (such a shame).

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with small rooms, but nixe and clean”
Reviews.Author: Roppie83
Reviews.Content: Small hotel. Bathrooms are very small. Everything clean and cosy. Close to Rialto bridge and in middle of shopping area

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience, haunted by mildew smell”
Reviews.Author: jamie2888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights recently with my sister and was disgusted at the way the entire place smelled. We are pretty easy and were traveling on a budget, but when I smelled my room I was so turned off. There must have been some flooding or something, but the entrance was wet and smelled and the room smelled even worse. The window did open and we were able to get air. The place is inexpensive and in a great spot, but I could not distract myself from the mildew!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!!”
Reviews.Author: kloug17
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Venice and couldn't be happier that we stayed at the San Lio TH(Isabella room). Yes it is quite basic and small and there is but the staff were polite and helpful, it was clean, nice hot showers, great comfortable bed, air con, and a fantastic location the Rialto Bridge only 2/3min walk and St Mark's sq 5-10mins depending on what route you take. The only thing I would suggest is to go straight to Ca' Bragadin Carabba hotel which is a 2min walk from San Lio as this is where you have to check in and it will save you carrying your luggage up and down the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but carpet on the walls”
Reviews.Author: Chorltongal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located - only five minutes from Rialto, but that is where the postives end I'm afraid. The hotel is very tired and in need of some urgent tlc. The room was small and had limited natural light. The bathroom was also reminiscent of that of a caravan at a Haven holiday park.... and worse of all, the walls of the bedroom were carpeted! Ugh! The Tourist House is unmanned, with check-in being at another (much nicer looking) hotel around the corner. Quite a strange set-up. There was also no free wifi. I know that cheap hotel accomodation in Venice is hard to come across - but those travelling on a tighter budget should not have to ensure they have drank enough before they return to their accomodation to make sure they can sleep (which is what we resorted to!). Thank god for Prosecco!! I wouldn't recommend, but if you do stay here I would suggest you take your own pillowcase and a hip flask.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Rialto”
Reviews.Author: BajanDreamer
Reviews.Content: Well, how do I start? I was shocked at prices for hotels in Venice but as there aren't many rooms then I guess I can understand why. I had a single room and my friends dining table was bigger. I had to keep my suitcase on the bed an move it when I wanted to sleep. I had a seperate bathroom and toilet. There was an outside balcony in a courtyard with a small table and two chairs. Breakfast was available but this was in another building so I didn't bother, there are lots of places to eat right outside the door. The room and building was tidy and clean so I can't really complain. I didn't go to Venice to sit in my room. If I went again then I would pay more and get a bit more comfort but I can't really complain about it as far as value for money. All my friends paid 2 or 3 times I paid. There was no internet as advertised which annoyed me.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: VogCo
Reviews.Content: The worst I lived in Italy!! According to the room size and the environment, not worth for this price!! I stayed for 2 nights, no air-condition and window cannot open!! I told to the staff about this happen and he replied me "it was broken"!!!! The only fresh air came to the room from the washroom exhaust!!!!.....so ridiculous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: LauraQ1986
Reviews.Content: Location was very easy to find, just follow the map and its a 5 minute walk from Rialto Bridge. We checked in very late (about 1am) as our flights had been delayed, the receptionist was instantly available for our help. Yes you have to collect the key from another bulding but again its less than 5 mins walk and is very easy to find. I was expecting a very small room given the reviews but our spacious double had room for a large bed, desk, wardrobe and an armchair. The bathroom was fairly small but who spends much time in there anyway! For price and location, this place cannot be beaten!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money ratio.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel187323
Reviews.Content: Seeking a place to stay for a few nights in Venice turned out to be difficult. Every where I turned it was either very expensive or too far away. I found this house via Google Maps. I place was very clean and the room was big enough to leave our two large cases open on the floor. It was a bit loud from passing tourists - as it is on one of the main routes through Venice. But as Venice has practically no night life it was quiet by about ten.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced - very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mhavenhand
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in the San Lio Tourist House at the start of April 2011. Although the rooms were clean, the hotel should be rated 1 star rather than 3 stars. We paid over 100 Euro per night for a room worth a third of this price. You are definately paying for the location, which is extremely convenient for the Rialto Bridge. However, Venice being so small, a similar priced superior hotel in a more quaint location would be a wiser choice and still be in easy walking distance of all the major sights. The room was very small with mold on the walls. The bathroom was tiny and leaked water all over the floor. The safe wasn't even attached to the wardrobe and could easily be picked up and carried.

Reviews.Title: “Only one thing going for it - central location.”
Reviews.Author: Julie_HYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the San Lio. Our room was very small with the smallest shower cubicle we have ever seen! It was a work of art trying to have a shower in it. The room was clean and basic but very noisy due to the busy street below the bedroom window and a lack of double glazing. There was also a lot of noise from adjoining rooms, doors banging etc. If you do stay here we would recommend using the little cafe bar (Marti's) opposite for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: BoboMay
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern bathroom. Room a bit ugly and shabby, but clean and spacious.. Excellent location from Rialto Bridge. Easy to find IF you memorize and take good notes from the youtube video they send. Check in at a separate location, but it was easy to get to and only took a couple of minutes. Staff was very helpful and friendly and let us check in early. Sub-par for American standards, but what a great value for Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: BeerTree
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and went to a different sister hotel to check ourselves in. The environment there was extremely unwelcoming. We had to walk through a room and long stairs in total darkness (until my bf was smart enough to find the switch to turn on the light). Then the reception guy was there upstairs but he didn't help or guide us back to San Lio to get our room which is a couple of blocks away. We got the cheapest most basic room and it reflects well the price we pay. The room was very small; we barely had enough room to keep our baggage. They lift air-conditioning as it's already September. The windows opened straight to the main public stairways and invited in the mosquitoes so we felt really uncomfortable. The room service lady just didn't bother to come back after we told her to come back 30 mins later. The bathroom was clean and acceptable though I'd say. The public area was stinky and the carpet soggy after the rain. Location is convenient enough. Venice is an ultra-expensive city so this is pretty much what I expected given the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “More positives than negatives!”
Reviews.Author: cs97mmr2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the last week of September, on the whole there are more positives than negatives and we would definitely stay here again. In summary: Positives: - location cannot be beaten, literally 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge - fantastically helpful staff; I needed to hold a video conference over wi-fi and the staff bent over backwards to help me execute this (the wi-fi can be accessed at the sister hotel where you check-in) - clean rooms - fridge in the room Negatives: - the street the San Lio is located in is a very busy street so we heard noisy (perhaps drunk) diners shouting at the tops of their voices until about 11pm at night then at 6am the next morning cafe owners would open their establishments thus disturbing us again - the shower was very small - when front/main doors are closed, a lot of the windows shake thus disturbing you again On the whole, more positives than negatives!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location on a noisy square”
Reviews.Author: RJP99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite basic but is also very good value and its location is fantastic. It is very easy to find from the Rialto Bridge (following the supplied map) and the check in proceedure, although a little different, is very quick and friendly. Venice is all on the doorstep and you can walk or take the water bus/taxi from very close by. The San Lio square on which the hotel is located is very noisy to quite late but what else would you expect in a city centre packed full of open air bars,restaurants and stalls selling food/drink/souveniers! The room we were given is the same one as featured on this site and was clean and tidy with a good shower etc. It was serviced every day and had both a fridge and air conditioning. In summary, great value and well plced for a trip to venice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: muttans
Reviews.Content: San Lio TH is very clean & easily approachable hotel in Venice . I strongly recommend the hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cbrendza
Reviews.Content: When I stay in hotels I expect the room to be clean and the hotel to be safe. Campo San Lio exceeded these standards. Wonderful staff, good breakfast, and a great location. About a 3 minute walk to Rialto, and about a 8 minute walk to San Marco. Venice is a beautiful city and I recommend spending as much time as possible walking the streets and canals and this hotel was a great place to get some much needed rest at the end of the day

Reviews.Title: “Pay for something nicer.”
Reviews.Author: MelonLord
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say I hated this hotel. We were greeted by a talking head on a Skype monitor who gave us directions to another hotel where he was, and where we had to go to check in. Turns out that Max Headroom was very helpful, but that was the ONLY good thing about this hotel. I admit that it was almost the cheapest I could find, so I got what I paid for. Had I known, I would have paid for something nicer. Besides the overall creep factor, there is NO soundproofing whatsoever, so we were jarred out of an already uncomfortable sleep every time the neighbors slammed their door. Which was often.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: yun00000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and comfortable. However, was lost in searching for the check in reception. It would be good if the owner can provide map filled with street names so that i can always be certain on my location.

Reviews.Title: “DISGRACE”
Reviews.Author: lotustai
Reviews.Content: I paid for 3 nights to stay in one of your room with a view of Riatio Bridge and 2 single beds, i was delay because of flight disruption, and i was one day late, i thought once i paid for a room in full and the room would be mine whether i turn up or not. i was at the airport the whole day and night, can't reach you no internet, By the time i arrive in Venice all i get is a box of a room or nothing else, your reception man was telling me that i was late and the room was given away, how can you give my room away when i had paid for it???? is this how things work in Venice or just your HOTEL?????

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sessyle
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful place to stay in Venice, it's near enough to most of the places of interest. Staff's great, very nice and helpful. The price of the room had made us expect something like a cheap hostel, so we were very pleasantly surprised that we received a well furnished and very comfortable hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: MisterMK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre of venice, just a few minutes walking from the bus (over water, ferrovia) station Rialto. From here it's a ~15 minute walk to piazza san marco or ~30 minute walk to the piazzale roma (where the busses stop). Both can be done faster using the bus. The hotel is small (it has about 6 or 7 rooms), and you need to check-in in another hotel nearby, which can be a bit of a struggle to find (as many buildings in venice, you cannot really tell from the outside that it is a hotel). The rooms in the hotel are relatively small (comparably to other budget hotels), and especially the bathroom (especially the shower) is very small. Also the windows are single-glass and as you are next to a busy path you'll hear a lot of street noises starting as early as 6.30 pm and also at night when people walk home from the bars. However the great location in the centre of Venice and the low costs of stay there make it a great hotel for a budget stay in the centre of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: vit666
Reviews.Content: Located between the popular areas of Rialto and St Marks Square. Decent rooms, but don't expect any frills. Room service virtually non-existent, but reception staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A small charming Inn”
Reviews.Author: nÃ³inÃ­n
Reviews.Content: We booked San Lio through hostel world and the directions they sent us were spot on. However, when we got there, there was no one in reception, but there was a map and directions to another building, about two minutes walk away. The name outside this building was "Ca Bragadin, A Small Charming Inn". It lived up to this description. Our room was in this building and it was beautiful. Extravangantly decorated, Spacious, clean, with a tv. The staff told us that they only switch on the air-conditioning in the summer. The "continental breakfast" E7 each and very basic- Fresh Bread, juice from a carton and tea or coffee. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing and the staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Lori19
Reviews.Content: Even though we booked this hotel through lastminute we were sent a very nice email and a map with directions to the hotel direct from the San Lio. They also answered my queries sent by email. When we arrived they were very pleasant and very helpful. Even though we arrived much too early, they let us choose which room we wanted out of two. The rooms were very clean and althought the furniture was basic it was fine. There is a small fridge in the room and a hairdryer in the bathroom. There are no tea or coffee making facilities, but we knew that and took a travel kettle. The room had three big windows, overlooking a square with a cafe and a couple of market stalls. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops close by. There was quite a lot of noise from the square through night but we were also aware that this was possible but it was nice having the view too. The location is great, only a few minutes from the Rialto Bridge and a short walk to St Marc Square. These are both sign posted in yellow and therefore it is easier to get about without getting lost. I absolutely loved Venice and would love to go back one day. If I did I would definately consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “room small like a wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: steffenxy
Reviews.Content: horrible small and expensive Hotel - if u don't like small rooms you should avoid staying there. Very old furnitures, dirty carpet, needs to prepaid without getting a receipt, reception closed most of the time, loud house - the only great thing was the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Looked like a nice to stay ...”
Reviews.Author: karcus
Reviews.Content: We also booked at this tourist house via hostelworld.com and was told that there were problems with the air conditioning so was shifted on to a different hotel across the piazza to a room WITHOUT air conditioning but with breakfast. We had specifically chosen air conditioning as my wife was pregnant. After some renegotiating with the new hotel it was sorted but it could have been handled better. So other than that can't comment on the place - it look nice and was in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne35
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually get to stay in this hotel!! We tried to arrange our accomodation via Hostelworld.com. Everything initially seemed ok, but then 12 hours before we were due to leave for Italy, we received an email from the hostel indicating that there was a pre-authorisation problem with our credit card. We duly contacted our credit card provider and learnt that they had not had any request from the hostel regarding the credit limit on our card regarding our stay. We then contacted the hostel and found that they refused to check our credit card details over the phone, and claimed that they would only accept these details via email (HOW INSECURE WOULD THAT BE!!) The hostel then proceeded to re-sell our room, leaving us with nowhere to stay and forcing us to arrange a last minute alternative at increased cost. An additional aside - hostelworld.com have still not replied to our e mails for help in this matter, and we are still trying to retrieve the deposit that we paid them to gain what they confirmed as a secure booking with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gossipandtravel
Reviews.Content: We actually found this place on hostel world, but it was more of a hotel than a hostel. We arrived late at night and the reception staff were so helpful - they even offered to come collect us from the boat once we arrived at the Rialto (I was very impressed). The location was excellent, perfect for siteseeing, and the place was a bargain given how expensive venice can be. The rooms were a bit noisy at night so I would recommend earplugs, and I'd also mirror the earlier comments made on here about the shower (it was an experience). All in all a very pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: WalsallJetsetter
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very near to all the main sights, including the Rialto Bridge, St. Marcs square etc. The hotel itself was an ideal base for exploring the city and the rooms were very clean and had everything that we need. The check in process was easy and quick and they were very helpful in advising us on where to get something to eat and how to get to the main attractions. There is a bit of noise at night from the street but not anything too bad. Would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: toonsteve
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Venice! Much of Venice is operates hugely inflated prices and this is the exception. The location is superb. You are literally 5 mins walk from the Rialto and, therefore, pretty much in the centre of Venice. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate, very clean indeed and quiet. The Dutch bar did not bother us (a previous review complained about the noise) and in fact it was a very welcome place as one of the few open after 11pm! If you want quiet insist on a inward facing room (ours was) and it's perfectly quiet. It's not luxury by any means but it's not a hostel either. This is a good, clean, central place to stay for a fraction of the price of most other places in Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: San Lio Tourist House
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5607 | Rialto - Campo San Lio, 30122 Venice, Italy
